    "Password": "xx"

CreateIndex.title: Creating an automated index

CreateInstance.document: This example shows you how to create an ES cluster instance based on the input parameters.
CreateInstance.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: es.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateInstance
<Common request parameters>

{
    "EsVersion": "6.4.3",
    "VpcId": "vpc-xxxxxx",
    "NodeInfoList": [
        {
            "NodeType": "ES.S1.SMALL2",
            "NodeNum": "3",
            "Type": "dedicatedMaster"
        },
        {
            "DiskSize": "100",
            "NodeType": "ES.S1.SMALL2",
            "NodeNum": "2",
            "Type": "hotData",
            "DiskType": "CLOUD_SSD"
        }
    ],
    "Zone": "ap-guangzhou-3",
    "ChargeType": "POSTPAID_BY_HOUR",
    "SubnetId": "subnet-xxxxxx",
    "Password": "xxxxxx",
    "InstanceName": "es_test"
}
CreateInstance.title: Creating an ES cluster instance

UpdateInstance.document: This example shows you how to rename an ES cluster instance.
UpdateInstance.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: es.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: UpdateInstance
<Common request parameters>

{
    "InstanceId": "es-xxxxxx",
    "InstanceName": "newName"
}
UpdateInstance.title: Renaming an ES cluster instance

UpdateInstance.document: This example shows you how to scale out/in or scale up/down an ES cluster instance or a dedicated master node, or to add a dedicated master node. `NodeInfoList` must contain the information of all target nodes to be passed in.
UpdateInstance.title: Modifying the node specification of an ES cluster

UpdateInstance.document: This example shows you how to modify the configuration of an ES cluster instance.
UpdateInstance.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: es.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: UpdateInstance
<Common request parameters>

{
    "InstanceId": "es-xxxxxxxx",
    "EsConfig": "{\"action.destructive_requires_name\":\"true\"}"
}
UpdateInstance.title: Modifying the configuration of an ES cluster instance

UpdateInstance.document: This example shows you how to reset the Kibana password of an ES cluster instance.
UpdateInstance.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: es.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: UpdateInstance
<Common request parameters>

{
    "InstanceId": "es-xxxxxxxx",
    "Password": "newPwd_123"
}
UpdateInstance.title: Resetting the Kibana password

UpdateInstance.document: This example shows you how to scale up/down a cluster in terms of its node spec (number of cores, memory size) and disk size.
UpdateInstance.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: es.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: UpdateInstance
<Common request parameters>

{
    "InstanceId": "es-xxxxxxxx",
    "DiskSize": "150",
    "NodeType": "ES.S1.MEDIUM4"
}
UpdateInstance.title: Scaling up/down an ES cluster

UpdateRequestTargetNodeTypes.document: For clusters with a hot-warm architecture, you can assign requests from clients only to hot nodes when warm nodes have relatively low specifications. In this case, only the hot nodes work as coordinators.
UpdateRequestTargetNodeTypes.title: Updating the node types used to receive client requests

UpgradeInstance.input:

    "EsVersion": "6.4.3"
}
UpgradeInstance.title: Upgrading ES cluster version
